sentences: Super Junior-D&E (Korean: 슈퍼주니어-동해&은혁, also known as  Donghae & Eunhyuk, D&E or SJ-D&E) is the fifth sub-unit of South Korean boy band Super Junior, formed by SM Entertainment in 2011.
section: N/A

sentences: It is composed of two Super Junior members: Donghae and Eunhyuk.
section: N/A

sentences: The duo debuted on December 16, 2011, with their digital single "Oppa, Oppa".
section: N/A

sentences: The duo released their first full-length Japanese album Ride Me on February 26, 2014, and started using name Super Junior-D&E since then.

sentences: They released short version of "Motorcycle" promotional video (PV) on February 2.

sentences: The song became the main theme of the Japanese TV show, 'Sukkiri'.
section: == History == | === 2014–15: Ride Me, The Beat Goes On, Present and hiatus ===

sentences: The duo held their first Japan tour kicked off in Nagoya on 4 March 2014, going through 8 cities including Osaka, Hiroshima, Fukuoka, Kobe, Niigata, Budokan and Tokyo for 22 performances.

sentences: They sang a total of 22 songs, including "I Wanna Dance", "Oppa Oppa", and "BAMBINA".

sentences: The boys wrapped up their concert from May 8 to 10 in Budokan, attracting a total of 100,000 fans for their 1st Japan Tour.
